text:
Starting with the previous review, I don't know what the smoking laws are here in Vegas, but  they make no sense as applied in this place. The take out window is the only thing that is non-smoking. That said, I think the smoking laws are kinda silly so it didn't bother me. Everything else about this place did...

The food was nothing special and bordered on horrible. Garlic cheese bread was soggy in some places while overbaked around the corners. Chicken tenders were clearly just reheated out of a frozen bag , which could be alright since they come flavored-dipped, except they give you 4 of the most pathetic looking pieces for $8 and the sauces sucked. If you're looking for good bar food you can do 1000x better elsewhere in Vegas; if you're looking for crap, then I guess you've discovered the right place.

Bar food can be hit or miss, so what else is going on at Tap House? $3.50 for a on-tap Hoegaarden wasn't bad, but it was a rather small glass given what can be had at other area sports bars. Their beer selection is average; nothing special. 

Finally, what brought me to this place. They advertise themselves as the home of Cleveland's sports teams, so being a Cleveland sports nut, I decided to go here for Game 5 of the Eastern Conference Finals. Bad call. Half of the crowd wasn't paying any attention, which while not the place's fault, probably wasn't helped by the fact that half the TVs were on other things (replays of old Dodger games and trivial pursuit reruns). Adding insult to this injury? Their placemat that proclaims their love of the Cavs SPELLS CAVALIERS INCORRECTLY (see the picture I've uploaded). Seriously guys? That's inexcusable. 

So to recap: don't come here for the food, not worth coming here for the drinks, and definitely not an actual Cleveland sports bar. This leaves us with no real reason to come here at all. Good riddance.

By the outside you would not think this tavern held a wealth of entertainment from local artists and a live band on Monday nights, except for the over-flowing parking lot. Enter the front door and you'll see the normal tavern with a few customers eating at the booths and drinking at the bar, some even taking in a couple slot rounds. However, mosey down the hall and you enter the world of the 50 plus crowd where drinks are plenty, food is hearty, and the entertainment a delight. LIVE music, Frank, WIllie, Neil, Charlie, Connie and more from the tribute artists that stop by to give you a taste of their local shows, not to mention the wonderful band under the direction of Ned Mills. A small dance floor doesn't seem to inhibit the locals from packing it to the brim and having a wonderful night on the town. Surprise! Surprise!

OK! Two words. GREAT PRICES.

Great prices on food, great quality. The product may not be what you pay for but I definitely see myself getting a bang for the buck every time I pay a visit.

My girlfriend and I pay a visit every couple of months or so. We used to smoke cigarettes, that's long forgotten about but we don't mind those that do. So yes, it is a smoky bar. But get over it, it's a bar. Want a bar without smoke? Go to Applebee's. 

We go for the 3.50 Hoegaarden. A belgian import. Blue Moon's Idol. Shock Top's Idol. The beer that puts both Blue Moon and Shock Top to shame. Hoegaarden was the originator. The first Belgian White. So give it a whirl. It's expensive. 8 to 10 dollars a six pack so if you want a full pint on draft for less go to the Taphouse. 

We drink the Hoegaarden with the pizza, original crust. Throw some veggies on there, a little pepperoni, sausage or meatball and it's a done deal. Great pizza. A bang for the buck and a cool laid back place to take my lady. 

The service may not be 100 percent but damn those ladies get it right. Shuffleboard is available for play too. Cheap drinks, cheap food for a good experience. I can't protest.

As for the food, the girls are fresher than the food in their short shorts.
The place is dingy..It might be a good hang out if you like smokey bars with poker machines. Once was enough for me.
This is a dive !!!

Wow. Employees who should be working r pumping money into the juke box playing music. When customers who are paying to keep the lights on have to wait 2 hear they're songs. The server just informed me that ill have to wait 8 plus songs to here what I played...I'm a paying customer. Really WFT. Someone  needs 2 fire this bitch. Oh wait her sister is the bar manager. That'll never happen. Hey jimmy and bob wake the fuck up and clean house. Your shit is gonna go down hill.Demographics   have change

Somewhat of a dive bar, gaming bar, Browns bar, Italian restaurant experience. It's hard to go wrong with the pizza though the menu sizes may be a bit misleading. Tap House is a Vegas gem in its casual vibe. 

* Though not the norm, our service tonight was nonexistent. We waited 15 minutes after requesting the check and finally we walked to the bar to close out. I'm glad this wasn't my only experience or it would have been a very generous 3 star.

I visited the Tap House one Monday evening while I was visiting Vegas. A singer from New Jersey, I'm sorry I forgot  his name, was performing there.  I had one of the best nights I have ever had in town.  People from all over the industry stopped into perform.  I had a great dinner and drinks and I think our bill was $70.00 for the three of us.  The last time I saw that many pinky rings in one room Bobby Kennedy was going after Hoffa.  The food and the service were genuine.  We shall return.

Great favorite of hubby and yours truly! Best wings in town, by far! Get the cajun... OMG! Waitresses are the best, service is awesome. They also have tons of pretty cool sports memorabilia. My favorite there is the margherita pizza, thin crust, and I add their sausage, oh their sausage! This place is awesome! Everybody should try it!
ABSOLUTELY the BEST wings in Vegas. Hands down. Love the food, love the vibe, love the staff! Excellent service and always a great time!
My first visit and it was cool! I love cousy pubs!!! Not to thrilled it's a Cleveland Browns Bar, but hey that just means I can't go there during football games! LOL!!!!

I've been there twice and all times I've been nothing short of amazed. Granted, I was with my cousin at midnight when they discount pizza.

There's this bartender there that always wears an LSU polo. I forget his name but he played with basketball Hall-of-Famer "Pistol Pete" Marovich. He had a framed photo and everything. I enjoyed the stories as a basketball fan.

This bar is Browns fan central with memorabilia and all that but that didn't bother me. Probably because there's no football going on right now. 

I'd definitely go here again if I'm ever in Vegas.
The wings are awesome! The Sunday waitresses are so friendly every one knows your name or they give you one.  We've been going here every Sunday since 2010 when we moved to Vegas

The service was great, but the food was even better. My boys and I enjoyed everything here. The pizza was the best and the wings were pretty good too. This place has a very classic feel to it. Overall, a good spot to hit for cheap eats and drinks.

Best wings in Vegas? Definitely top 2 I've had. I'm not 21 so I can't go in but I get to go wings and they are incredible. Dry rubbed and baked so you don't feel gross after you eat them, not oily at all and the ranch is incredible as well! Must must must try! Good price for the amount and quality of wings.

This place is a hidden gem. I first came here because it's known as an Ohio sports bar. But now, I will continue to come back because of the great food and friendly people.

I like to come on Sunday's to watch the Browns during NFL season. It is very busy, so we get there early. The beer specials are great and the food is even better! We have eaten pizza, wings, french dip, and pasta and each dish was honestly fantastic. Everything tasted so fresh and was made with care.

My only compliant is the smoking... it's really bad during games , but other times it's tolerable. Nevada isn't very enlightened when it comes to indoor smoking, so this is to be expected. It's not really a big deal, but for those of you from out of town who aren't used to it, yes you'll be surprised at the smokiness.

Try this place out if you want an authentic old-school Vegas experience. Great food, great prices, and great service!

This Cleveland Brown Bar Has The Best Pizza in Las Vegas Hands-Down!!!! Why You Ask??? They Put Beer in There Pizza Dough!!!!! Not to Mention Its Half Price On Graveyard!!!!! Also Famous for their Cajun Double Baked Chicken Wings & Itallian Disehs!!!! A Must for any Las Vegas Local!!!
try the cajun wings !    the pizza is also good.   good atmosphere and staff what else could you ask for.   take your own risk at the gambling just like everywhere else.
Awesome place that I've overlooked for years. Great food and staff would recommend to everyone over 21.

Cajun wings by far, very proud they offer breaded pork sandwich! Yum. Pretty decent pizza.

Busty staff which kinda makes it a sausagey festy sports bar, might as well make it a Roman Sauna but okay, good food and somehow always good music playing..
Fantastic Italian Restaurant!!!    Nicole & Vinny are really nice & it's just a great place to go either for a drink or for a meal.

No bells and whistles. Standard Vegas bar food. Usually get late night 1/2 off pizzas. Stopped in for Thursday night FBall, nice lil FBall menu. Pastrami Sandwich was pretty good...Sam on tap was great.

It had been awhile since we'd been to the Tap House, but my husband was hankering for a fish sandwich and I saw on their online menu that it was available here. Not really an "Italian favorite," but it would work in a pinch.

He ordered the aforementioned sandwich, and I got an Italian sub. Both came with fries, and we each had a beer. The food was fine, and the prices were reasonable. But service was SUPER slow, and our waitress never came back to check on us until after we were done, so no drink refills for us.

It was pretty crowded for a Saturday afternoon -- maybe because they have half-priced pizzas on the weekend. Most people seemed to be ordering pizzas or Cajun wings, which is another of their specialties. They both looked pretty good to me! And the restaurant seemed brighter and less smoky that I remembered. But unless the service picks up a little, I'm not sure when I'll be back. (Maybe when I have a little more time for lunch...)

I like it! The wings live up to the hype, the bartenders are great, and most importantly, they have those wonderful machines that take the smoke smell (mostly) out of the air.  I wish all local bars did so.
This is our favorite place to have lunch,  the staff is awesome. Bartender Carol rocks she is so up beat and happy.  She's the best. There is also a lady a little older at dinner she is awesome.

Ok....here we go. I'm going to make this short. I love yelp and the yelpers, and I feel I would be doing everyone a desservice if I was lazy and enjoyed the food/ service and never said a thing about this place. Best philly I have had in my life...it was rediculous. I'm a native to Vegas and have been to them all. Try it for yourself, you won't be disappointed. 

The end.

This place is just rocking on Monday nights, the atmosphere is incredible, the singers come from all over Vegas to sing,, The people are friendly, and best of all its free..

The only issue is the place is small so it gets very busy..Food is fantastic, the Pizza is just amazing. love it and will be back next Monday night.

Thanks Tap House keep up the good work.

My boyfriend, a good friend and I suffered an unwarranted, absurd, FRIGHTENING experience at The Tap House early this morning, between 4:00 and 5:00 AM. It was so bad that I felt the need to publicly share our experience, with the hope that I can prevent something like this from happening to anybody else.

After a late night out, we stopped in for an early morning bite- nothing unusual. The Tap House is open 24/7, good food, decent prices, no bad experiences prior. Why would we assume anything would be different this time? The unsmiling, hard-staring bartender, RICH, seated us, and brought us drinks (two glasses of water, one iced tea). Immediately, I was put off that a gigantic cigar was dangling from his mouth almost the entire time, but not enough to mention it. Before our food came, he asked us if we wanted to split the check- my boyfriend and me on one, our friend on another. All three of us responded with an audible "yes," and nodded our heads. Rich served us our food with the lit cigar still precariously resting between his lips, and aside from the fact that I asked for provolone cheese on my burger and got American, everything tasted all right. I didn't even complain about it. I'm a really easy customer- so is my boyfriend, and so is my friend. None of us caused any issues- we ate our food, laughed among ourselves, and then waited for our checks (for a long time). Rich returned with a single tab. Not a huge deal.

Then, it got ugly. My boyfriend very politely asked RICH to split the check, and Rich was immediately hostile and uncooperative. He was condescending, unprofessional, and ultimately accused us of not telling him we wanted the check split (even though we 100% did), and made it very clear he would definitely not split our check now. I was appalled and offended, so I verbally expressed my feelings to Rich at the bar. I explained to him that myself, my friends, and multiple generations of my family have been eating at the Tap House for years, some for decades, and that I was utterly disappointed, shocked, and offended by his behavior.  We bickered for a bit; still, I handed him the card for payment. His response was, "I'll do you one better- it's on the f*cking house!" He told us he didn't need our money, and to leave and never return (including anybody related to me), at which point we exchanged some profane words.

Then, Rich became violent. He ran out from behind the bar to CHASE US outside, while threatening to use physical violence against us. All the other bar patrons followed us outside, which was terrifying because they were all drunk, aggressive, and rallying to Rich's side. We feared for our safety as the they gathered, and as Rich attempted to shove my boyfriend out of his way to throw punches at me. We finally got into our car and locked the doors, but Rich continued to pound on my car doors and windows, screaming obscenities at us, still threatening to physically harm us. I made a split decision to reverse my car and slam my brakes, honestly to scare off the crowd that now encased us. And finally, the nightmare was over.

We filed crime reports at the police station. The entire experience is presumably on tape, which will only verify the accuracy of my report.

Rich is unpredictable, dangerous, and a threat to perfectly normal, paying customers. So sad and shocked that this took place at The Tap House.

My original Vegas haunt from 1994,  I still love this place. I don't frequent as often as I once did, but the staff who doesn't know me from my regular days always make me feel welcome. The 24 hour "bar food" menu may be the best ever. Great pastas, pizzas and if you like wings ask about the twice-baked ones. Shuffleboard table is always fun (once you learn its unique curves), and great place for a private event. Classic Vegas at its best.
The service sucks but the food is great. Been here several times and know that's what to expect. The womens bathroom is made for a barbie doll.

I come here about once a week. From the food service from Nicole or DONNA and the classic drinks from Richie and Vinnnie there's no other local watering hole that I would go too. I remember my dad telling me about this place as a kid and so excited every time I come in, the old school bar has that time warp that is necessary with the over saturated strip. Thank you team at Tap house !!!

Driven by about a million times and would have never thought to stop had it not been for the invitation and recommendation from a buddy for lunch.  According to the website, TTH has been around since 1964.  When you look around and take in the sights and smells, it feels like it.  This is not necessarily a bad thing. You're in an old school American/Italian bar!

Old school feel and for those that care...an Ohio sports supporting location.

The service on both occasions was great!  Both ladies were attentive.  One one occasion my beer (Stella) was never empty for long.  On another occasion, my soda was never empty..

On both times I visited,  the Cajun chicken wings were outstanding!  I don't particularly care for wings, but will devour these every time!  The IMP (Italian Meat Pizza) was awesome.

Enjoy!

I love this place and try to go every time I visit Las Vegas.  It is old-school Vegas, which I adore, and getting harder and harder to find.  Pastas/salad/bread are always really good, so is the pizza.  My sister loves the meatball sub.

Totally disappointed in this place had read some of the reviews and all they talked about was how great their Philly cheese steak sandwich was so after a long days of work the hubby and I jumped in the car and headed up there 4 a bite to eat and a couple beers. Little did we know when we got up there we were surprised and disappointed because they were closed.

Came here yesterday for the 49ers-Seahawks game (which the refs won, by the way)...
Picked this place due to location, specials, and free wifi- they're literally a block from my home, feature half price pizza on weekends and as their late night 12AM-6AM special, and have inconsistent but free wifi.

Service needs work. We started out with one waitress who was polite but rarely around- it seemed she was the only one working, so we cut her some slack. Then after the first quarter, she started getting really pushy about dropping off the check and constantly checking to see if we had paid yet, even though there were hours left in the game.
Finally she straight up told us we had to pay so she could leave- now, if she'd just told us that from the start, in a friendly manner, I would have been totally cool with closing out early and tipping her early on. But she very obviously just wanted to go home and did not give a crap about stopping by to check on us until it affected her pay.  

As it is, the pizza was tasty but even they run on the small side- pay attention to the inches (M, 10") rather than the actual size (M, L, etc). We tried the Fellini and it was flavorful and loaded with toppings (salami, sausage, olives, bell peppers), and with the special it was priced well- I don't think I would pay full price for this pizza.
Also had an order of the "award winning" wings, medium heat- should have gone for hot because they didn't have any heat to them. Large order, good flavor, but not sure how this is the best in town.
BF had a few beers- once he realized how watered-down they were though, he switched to domestic.

The second server we got was much sweeter and more of a people person- an older woman with red hair. Felt bad that we'd already ordered everything we were hungry/thirsty for, but left a tip simply because she was so much better at her job: checked up on us regularly, was very friendly.

Heads up, this bar allows smoking indoors- not a bad thing on it's own,  but I'm not a fan. Luckily, only a couple of people smoked a cigarette or two while we were there. Was a little grossed out to see an employee smoking at the end of the bar, but I'll assume it was during her break.

I am a total pizza snob from Chicago and Tap House did not disappoint!

They offer a thick or thin crust, but I would call it NYC style (thick) vs Chicago (thin) crust.

The sauce is divine!
The veggies are crisp & fresh.

I totally loved this pizza and can't wait to come back.

The service was great.
Ladies are nice with smiles.
They treat you like you're in their house.

I wish it was a bit dimmer in the main room but that's just me.

Great job Tap House!

An old school place with great food and a good tap selection. Service is great and a chill atmosphere although sometimes scummy people wonder in off the busy street but they do a good job of moderating the crowd.

Cool dive bar and restaurant.  There's smoking allowed and it seemed like a lot of the people there are locals.  Not a typical place for tourists.  The food was good, the tap burger and steak sandwich.  The hot wings were perfect!! The bartender was very nice and welcoming.  The menu has a lot of variety and is fairly cheap!

Food was good-service was horrible. Real locals place. Waitress was practically all over her boyfriend (or whoever he was) almost the whole time. She never checked on me-I had to go to the bar to get my refills and my check. Sorry I'm not a local-but I have money too! I will never come back here again due to the sheer fact that they go out of their way to make you feel that you don't belong there. Whatever. There's plen of other places to go!

I like this place as much as one can like a pub/restaurant thing. The pizza here is out of this world, it is amazing. The drinks are fine, mostly just beers. However the skinny white waitress with the black curly ish hair, i don't remember her name, but she is the most rude, disrespectful human i have ever met. I was appalled by the way that we were treated. I understand that we came in late at night, but this place is 24 hours. You may not want to work that shift, but that does not mean you can be rude to customers, especially when we were so nice to you, until you started ignoring us, and making snarky remarks, and which point we ordered our drinks from the bar, just to avoid you.
Smoky local bar with a lot of personality.  The Cajun baked wings are very tasty and unlike anything you've had.  My go-to hole in the wall bar in Vegas!

If you like pizza this is the place. We got this place recomended from A person in another bar. And since we always go to pt's for their midnogth special. Tap house pizza is the real deal. Can't compare with the horribly dry crust from the competitors. Good ingredients. Friendly staff. We are definetly going back to try their wings as well.

I don't know what happened to this place, but it has gone downhill. From the food to the service everything about this place sucks. I used to love their cajun wings, I told everyone about them and how good they were. After last night though, I probably won't be back for a while.

Lets start with the food. We ordered a double order of the cajun wings, and asked for them to be double baked. I have ordered them this way many times and they always came out great. Well this time they came out burnt and had wayyy to much seasoning on them. They were sooo salty! We had to scrape most of the seasoning off and then had to order a side of hot sauce to dip them in to make them edible. We wanted a pizza, 1/2 white and 1/2 meat. Our server said No we couldn't do that because the white pizza has no sauce and the meat does. OK, I have worked in many pizza places before and have made split pizzas with different sauces on each half, or one half with sauce and one half without, and never had any problems. I don't know if this is their policy or if she was just being difficult, but since it is not impossible to do, I will just go with the latter. So since they could not accommodate a simple request, we ended up ordering 2 small pizzas, one white with sliced tomatoes, and one meat. They were almost $10 each, which is a total rip. They were TINY, basically personal size, probably enough for a child. Why the hell are they charging $10 for a child's pizza? 

So as we are sitting waiting for our food, in walks the mayor and her husband. As soon as that happened, I knew the service was going to suck, and I was right. Our waitress never brought us plates or came around to refill our drinks. My boyfriend must have tried to get her attention 4 different times, but she just ignored him. He was very polite about it too, but was almost yelling just to get her to acknowledge us. I know she heard him because she looked at him a few times and then just went on doing what she was doing, which was talking. How rude of us to interrupt her conversation.

And finally my last gripe is there is a small counter with a window that leads into the kitchen. I can see the cooks put the food up when it is ready to be delivered. I see my food being put up on the counter, the waitress goes to get it, and then tells the cook something along the lines of "this pizza is supposed to have tomatoes." So I see him throw a handful of diced tomatoes onto my pizza, cold. The exact same tomatoes that came with the tacos. I asked for SLICED tomatoes, which is listed as one of their toppings, and I did not want cold diced tomatoes on top of my pizza. At this point I am so annoyed that I don't say anything and just eat the $10 pizza. We spent over $40 for a shitty meal, with shitty service to boot. I will not be back anytime soon!

Yelp 2015 Review #26

The steamed clams were flavorful BUT.......they had a little too much sand still in them and they threw in a handful of canned clams on top. Took the waitress 20 minutes 25 minutes to take my order, it must have been those other 3 tables that had her tied up. When she came to refill my Diet Coke, she refilled it with ice tea, do you know how nasty that tasted??? When I called her on it, she gave me a refill with no straw!  She'll pay attention to that $1.00 tip!
I must say that this is a great little bar. Everyone is friendly and it's a clean place. The pasta is out of this world good and I highly recommend this to anyone.

Bartenders are awesome!
1/2 priced amazing pizza after midnight and saturdays and sundays!

Good pizza and italian sausages. Nice bar and layout. 

The italian mob from Cleveland runs this place...so no trash talking the Cavs, Browns or Indians...no matter how bad they stink
Its pretty much just decent greasy bar food, with a full bar and decent sandwiches.  Half of pizzas on the weekends makes it worth it.  That and it wont make you crap your pants.
I frequent the Tap House often and always have great food and service. Carol, Rachel and the rest of the staff fantastic!

I always thought Tap House was just a little old bar that I drove past everyday on my regular commute to work. My organization held its last fundraiser here and it had a great turn out. The food and drinks are good and cheap, their banquet room is perfect for what we had planned, and the staff was very nice! I plan on visiting and holding more events here in the future.

(try the wings!)

Gotta change the review since last time. Staff is always friendly that I've run into the last 5-6 times  (about 6 months or so). Food is great! The Cajun wings make me, "crazy"! ...and the thin crust pizza, with that ranch, insaneeeeee!! 

I can't go 5 stars just yet. I'm waiting for something above and beyond, let's see what happens tonight baby!

Love to eat Pizza & Hot wings @ Tap House. This place has The best pizza I have had in Vegas. The only thing that is a minus is the waitresses LAZY & never smile. But that does not stop me from going because I'm there for Wings and Pizza. I wish they would open a closer location near Centennial Hills.

Was here in December, so I'm a little late in writing this review. Came here at about 11:30pm and was pleasantly surprised that the food was pretty good. I suppose I shouldn't have been surprised since I came here because of a recommendation. I had the linguini & clams which were pretty good. I want to try the pizza the next time I'm in town. Our server, Nicole was friendly and did a great job.

This is the place to go for Spaghetti and meatballs.  they offer great service witha great menu and a good food selection.  

try the wings too
Best cajun wings, best Chef, Best Cesar salad!!! Me and my family just love the place!

Cool old bar
Great chicken cheese steak.
This is an "Original Las Vegas" type of dive bar.
Great food! Best wings in town. Ohio State football? This is the place to be to watch the game.

My favorite neighborhood bars. Great drink prices, the machines are loose, and there is always a few cute smiles working.
Pizzas are really good and half off on saturdays. 
First impressions from the outside is that the bar is old and small but when you get inside it has a nice neighborhood bar feeling. Like the show Cheers.  They have a restaurant area and a bar. They have an abundance of flat screens for the games and they will even change the channel for you for your favorite team. They have a large banquet area that tends to be busy all the time with different car groups and receptions. 
I really like the Fellini's pizza. The bread is homemade and the cheese is delicious. The tacos on Tuesday are really good too. They are american style but they hit the spot. 

FYI
I have seen families there with the kids after sport games so I guess its a kid friendly restaurant.

I am rarely voluntarily away from Vegas for long. Sure there are those times that the state wishes I occupy one of their rooms for 3 to 6 years, but we have all had those times.  

I came back for my birthday and I visited many of my old haunts. I was longing for nostalgia. I was longing for strong drink. I was longing for weak companionship. I hit many of my favorite places...and the Tap House was one of them.

I longed to play shuffleboard, drink beers and listen to good music. When I am near Summerlin there is only one place I go to. So I swung into the bar around midnight and spend the rest of the night throwing back drinks with friends. 

The pizza was half price and that was just right for us. We tried three of the pizzas and they were amazing. I also had to order my favorite Chicken Parmigiana. It was as wonderful as usual. 

Right next door used to be a Las Vegas institution called Fellini's.  They have since moved their restaurant to the Sun Coast Casino to ply their trade. The good news is that they still deliver their freshly made sauces and they are amazing as always.  So you basically get to eat the same food for half the price and get reasonable priced drinks.

The bartender knew it was my birthday and comped me drinks and was totally cool. He treated Rex like the way Rex demands to be treated. It is important to treat Rex well...and he knew that. He could see it in the eyes.

I want to address the smoking issue one person brought up...and I will say...grow up!  People smoke in bars...but very rarely do they get to smoke in a place with a great shuffleboard table and amazing food.

I have removed one star because they have a crappy jukebox that plays edited songs. Ridiculous. Good music on there but not all the songs you would want. 

Go. Go often. Drink. Drink to Rex. You always should.
great pizza, cold beer.great place, those whiners with the 1 star should really stfu. For christ's sake, its vegas, you can smoke in church here ok?

Moving to Vegas from Atlanta, I wanted to immediately find my new watering hole. So I wandered around a bit, got completely lost as always.. Then I saw this sign for the tap house, advertising half off pizza! I mean, who DOESN'T want some tasty pizza while their drinking? Perfect! Even better, it's smoker friendly! I could have sworn vegas had  enacted some new smoker laws.. But I guess it's kind of like the traffic laws.. No one gives a sh*t. Anyways, the place looks like a complete dive from the outside, to the point where we almost didn't go in. Inside though, the place feels like an episode of Cheers. It's dark, it's nice and cool, and it's very obvious that most of the patrons and staff know each other. The beer is VERY reasonably priced, and they appear to other specials throughout the week as well. The pizza is absolutely delicious, awesome crust and sauce, and the garlic cheese bread is crazy good too. They also have jager bombs for 4.25, which my male loves. 
I have found my new watering hole. :)

Love this place... my dad and brother love it even more. They have the BEST  wings in vegas hands down, hot,mild and Cajun baked are the ones we get every single time. The place is a bar, dark and smokey and if your not any kind of Ohio fan, sorry it can get crazy. Donna our waitress is amazing, the other ones are a hit or miss..

Rachel greeted us with a smile immediately upon entry. The plan going in was to at least try some wings. Rachel recommended the dry Cajun wings. Typically a fan of a little moistness while nibbling, I was surprised by the wings. Great flavor with a little kick. The side salad was covered with grated cheese and croutons. Rachel advised us their pizzas are award winning, so the main course was the Italian Meat on regular crust. No thin crust for this crowd. We threw in an order of fries for good measure. Topped with garlic, they were some kind of nice. Rachel was very attentive and kept the drinks full. The atmosphere was casual and there are plenty of TV's throughout to enjoy the game. A return trip to the Tap House is definitely in order.

I love the Tap House! I enjoy every Monday night here. It's very "Old School Vegas" and I love it. With a live band every Monday night this place gets unbelievably packed. You have to literally reserve the chairs or your not getting in. The owner Jimmy is such a sweetheart and always takes care of us when we come in. Not to mention the food is great too! Flowing wine, live music and a dance floor you can't go wrong here!

Stumbled onto this place last night and I had the best chicken wings. Baked Cajun wings they call them. This tavern was clean, busy and the staff was great! If you are a chicken wing fan this place is a must stop!!

Their hot Italian sandwiches are pretty damn good at the Tap House. Great neighborhood bar with a good vibe. Menu is old school Italian classics and the portions are solid. Good place to grab a bite and watch the sports.

Good food at a good price. Unfortunately, smoking is allowed here in the dining area (I don't know how they get away with that) but the food is good. You have to try the double baked Cajun wings. I was a die hard buffalo wing fan until I tried these gems! I can't eat enough of them. Wait staff is very friendly.

This is a bar- with THE BEST bar food in town!!! Just stopped again and had the Tap House Burger- so darn juicy, big and yummy!!!  Their pasta is as good as any Italian restaurant- prices are great- daily specials and loads of salads!!! From breakfast to full dinners- this is the place for casual, awesome food!!

Yep has this place nailed on four stars. The staff was friendly, the service was excellent, the service and the food was fast!

On top of the above the personal Italian pizza that I had was excellent. The crust was nice, light and crispy. The toppings weren't too much or too little, it was just right. I couldn't ask for more out of this place for a pizza.

I will be back soon to try other things here.

I have driven by this place for many many decades thank God I finally found it oh my God is this pizza awesome not to mention the fish I had two weeks ago not to mention the steak sandwich I had a month ago and my wife loves the avocado shrimp salad.. everything is fresh and made on the premises... Also it's a very friendly environment our server Diana has always been so nice

rude bartender. she is snobbish, unprofessional. we wanted to order fries. she tells us that she will get us a waitress when we are sitting at a bar. ok fine. no waitress for 20 min. we asked her where is our waitress.  now she is asking us large or small. ??? what!  she goes again large or small. what a b@@@@ you definitely lost my business.
I love the twice baked Cajun wings! ;) I am a hot wing fan, and this is hands down one of my fav places! They also have a great atmosphere and amazing service! Our waitress, Norma was awesome!!!
WOW ... what fun! Great food, but amazing entertainment (Mark Giovi on Monday's). I will be coming back for more!

I've order the same thing here 3 times previous to today. I just ordered my usual: Medium cheese pizza and a large order of fries. I arrived and the order was more than I usually pay. The pizza was a (size) personal and instead of my fries being in the larger tray. I got a side of fries. I guess it all depends on the cook. This is the first time ordering here in the afternoon. Personally, I LOVE consistency. Back to my other pizza places of choice. Don't worry Tap House, I won't name the competition.

My boyfriend and I just came in for lunch and sat at the bar. The bartender Carol was on top of everything and took our order in a timely manner even though it seemed pretty busy. She was very friendly and funny too! We got the linguini with clams with white sauce (I modified it a little bit, got fettuccini noodles and added mushrooms and tomatoes) and he got a burger (I don't remember which one) and everything was tasty and affordable. We will definitely be coming back in the future.

I've been coming here for about five years and today was my last day. I sat down and pulled out my e-cigarette as I have been doing for the past three years. I ordered a beer and a menu. I decided on my usual and placed my order. When the server came back, she said I was not allowed to use my e-cigarette in there. As per the owner, "E-cigarettes are no longer allowed but cigarettes and cigars are." 

When I first started coming here, I was a smoker! The food is great and they have a nice draught selection. I have nothing against smoke or smokers, obviously because this place has tons of smokers who are usuals. I really liked the place too! The low ceilings combined with the chain smokers makes for a vintage Vegas experience that you really can't find much these days.

Don't try to apply logic here. It really makes no sense. I honestly think someone could get away with smoking a joint in here because there is that much smoke. Make sure you don't bring your electronic cigarette though, you could fill those with cannabis! The ironic part is that there's a sign out front that says 'smoker friendly.'

If the owner banned cigarettes AND e-cigarettes, that would somewhat make sense, but I STILL wouldn't go back. At least he was being consistent.

Do not go here to watch Buckeyes games either, they will yell at you for being loud when you are just cheering. I can't speak for Browns games on Sunday though. The local Buckeye bar is now Sporting Life on 7770 S Jones Blvd anyway and has been for several years now.

Pros: 
Very smokey, like Jazz pool-hall it has that smokey-blue tinge in the right light.
The usuals are all great!
The pizza is fantastic!

Cons:
No electronic cigarettes.

I used to sneak in here back in high school just to get pizza and wings 1/2 off after midnight. 10 years later and I'm still obsessed. Cajun dry rub wings and simple pepperoni will be the death of me. Older crowd for sure but still welcoming and friendly to locals. Hidden gem that has outlasted most things in the neighborhood. Nice staff, perfect portions, and fun crowd, especially if Johnny Cash is on the jukebox. Only advice is to always order extra ranch.

Atmosphere is a bit of a dive, we got seated, a regular old time waitress, taken our orders.  Haddock, one of their Friday specials USD 8.95.  I opted for another Friday special Shrimp Alfredo USD 13.95.  Great tasting food.  A hidden gem for their food.  Getting the bill to pay was very slow though.

I absolutely love this place! And the service is awesome . The food is great, never a long wait. My favorite is the steam clams, the best! I've been coming here as long as I can remember. And I must say, consistency across the board. Keep up the good work

Good bar food for a bar. Good drinks for a bar and a cool little place to hang out in after work. The servers are friendly but not the most attentive around . They do a good job on their pizza too. The cajun chicken wings are pretty darn good also.

Evidently this bar likes to ignore their customers. Very surprising in a city of competition. We could've eaten ANYWHERE in Vegas but we chose to eat here which NEVER happened because we got ignored for 15 or 20 minutes. No "I'll be right with you" NOTHING
They looked right at us and never came over or acknowledged us in any way.
I guess they don't want our business. Maybe we got judged but We are NEVER going there again. That used to be our hang out spot
Too bad
Smd

I was told i was getting a free sub card..
Never got it but im not surprised

Came here for a drink with my dad. Had a beer and a cocktail and Rich the bartender was extremely friendly and helpful. He came by ever so often to ask how we were and if we needed anything else. He was very welcoming and made me want to come back just to try the Cajun Wings (he spoke highly of this and I definitely need to try these!!). Great atmosphere. Lots of locals and the drinks were well made.

I rarely make it up to this side of town but my husband and I were headed to Plant World and needed to have some lunch before we got our shopping started. From the outside, The Tap House isn't anything exceptional but over the years I have learned that sometimes these dive looking places serve up great food at really reasonable prices. 

Little did we know that pizzas were half off on Saturdays until we were already seated and trying to decide if we should get one to split, or order separately.  It was like fate, how could we decide on anything else when the pizza was half priced? We ended up with the thin-crust veggie pizza, with olives on only half, plus banana peppers. We also split an antipasto salad.

To drink, had a jager bomb, which was just $4.50, and I had the option of regular or sugar free Red Bull. In a town where some places charge $5 or more for just a Red Bull, this is a great deal. 

Great deals mean nothing if the food sucks. This food did not suck. The antipasto salad was good sized with plenty of meat, and the pizza was cooked perfectly and loaded with toppings. 

If I lived in the area, I could see myself going to The Tap House often for dinner or just drinks.

Open 24/7 throwback to East Coast bars. Surprisingly large menu of italian favorites(in house made sausage), the best wings in LV and and a decent selection of beer. Prices are very reasonable and the service is good.  Tremendous amount of cigarette smoke is the only drawback. Good place to watch a game, drink ice cold beer and eat simply done bar food.

Really good Cajun baked wings plus if you go after midnight half off pizza get the large the medium is pretty small. The dining area is old and there is a smell of smoke in the air, great late night hang out!
Cool atmosphere.  Food was just ok.  Same with the service.  I went on a Monday to see the Jam Session and I will definitely go back.  I just won't eat there

We love the steamed clams & chicken wings. Went there on a Tuesday & tried their tacos which were also pretty darn good. Love the variety of their menu & selection of daily specials. Late night 50% off pizzas is also a great deal! Nice mom & pops kinda place with a comfortable layed back atmosphere. RACHEL is awesome behind the bar!!

I have been coming here for about a year and I must say Rich is one hell of a guy if it wasn't for him i would not return...I'm not saying the food isn't amazing because it is!!! Everything I've ever had was great ! But the only outstanding service I've had came from him..I'm a bartender on the strip and all the other casino bartenders I  know, knows Rick they all love him he holds tap house together...great personality great vibe he brings!!!  All industry people come see him after a hard day of work hello pick u up!

Food was pretty good, typical bar food. We had to ask for a menu, nobody welcomed us, we weren't checked on for the entire dinner, we had to seek a waitress out to even get the dinner. The whole process was rushed and unprofessional

Inside is beautiful comfortable the bartenders are awesome and could make drinks anyway that we like the food is phenomenal big portions everybody must try this place it is really good very friendly atmosphere the bartender's name is Richie and Julie
Favorite place for a cold beer and amazing cajun chicken wings! Mouth watering goodness! Service is great!

My my my what a pleasant surprise. I have driven by this establishment for YEARS...I will be stoping from now on. Food that is creative, delicious, affordable, and served by a staff that knows how to take care of you!!! This is the way bar/restaurants use to be in Las Vegas...BRAVO to the Tap House!!!

Food is ok for bar food. Honestly, I still do not order much when I come. Just for the company. The people who work here are very friendly and great but the few times I ordered, I didn't care for it. Maybe they have a better cook now. I mostly get drinks and eat elsewhere. But others in my group eat it and have no problem. Try it for yourself.

Great dive bar on Charleston! The Italian food here was awesome (for bar food). We tried the cheese sticks and meat pizza. The pizza and cheese sticks came hot and fresh, and the crust was perfectly baked. The pizza had a delicious spicy sausage and crispy pepperoni. The staff was also very friendly and attentive. This is a great place to come for some great bar food and gambling!

I love the Tap House. My friends and I refer to it as the Trap House which just means that we have hella fun here. Jukebox with all different kinds of music and the comfort in the dining environment keeps us enjoying Tap House multiple times a week; as well as the after midnight pizza special (half off after 12, the three cheese and margarita pizzas are my favs). Our fav server is definitely Nicole. She takes such good care of us every time and welcomes us with a smile no matter what. Her personality and her attentiveness to whatever we want is what makes her service above par. We all love and appreciate her and the T(r)ap House for giving us a place to enjoy ourselves nightly.

AWESOME!
Met friends for drinks after work July 2016 .. easy to find .. lots of parking.
Inviting interior - lots of charm.
Friendly service - good poors on mixed drinks.  Lots of on tap choices - Of course!!
Food was outstanding!  
Meatballs are a must try!
Pizza delish!
Fish & Chips - omg wonderful
Will definitely be back.

Some of our group ventured into the Music area and thoroughly enjoyed what was happening there!
Best little hidden gem in Vegas. Great chicken wings and pizza.

After 8yrs of watching The Ohio State Buckeyes @ Tap House. I will not be going back, after being called the N-word and purposely bumped in to and one of my friends was told he was too loud as he cheered for the team. I loss all enthusiasm for the game.

I love this bar, waitresses are friendly and the drinks are always cold.  The shuffleboard table is normally not in use so that is always an added bonus for me. 

I am a huge fan of their Twice Baked Cajun wings they always hit the spot and are cooked to perfection with a great flavor.  The pizzas are delicious as well and during the weekend they are buy one get one 1/2 off.

The only bad thing bad about this place is they are a cleveland browns bar and I am a diehard steelers fan. Food is friggin awesome and pizza is half off on the week ends. Chicken wings are equally awesome with ranch that is utterly addictive. And for all the fools below hating about the  smoking. Dude it's a bar. A BAR. Get over it.   More people need to go here

This is a old school place with a great feel.  They have good bartenders and good food.  I've been here a few times and not a bad experience yet. 

It's a Italian restaurant and provides a good menu and good music.  Not a huge beer selection but what they offer will do the job.

Their dry wings prove that the sauce is not always the boss! First thing first, they are definitely smoker-friendly, but I didn't find it any more overbearing than your average video poker hang. We just scouted out who was actively smoking and found the spot the farthest away from them. When I left, I wasn't nearly as smokey smelling as I am after visiting any casino in town. 

They have a great selection of bar games, including shuffleboard, and their TVs are nice! I think they may even be getting HD because the picture quality was mighty fine. It happens to be an Ohio sports bar, so Ohio State, Cleveland Browns fans take note, and Michigan fans beware. 

I actually really love the interior. There is plenty of lighting, and all of the half-circle booths (so romantic!) and high chairs are covered in red pleather, which gives it a nice touch of old school Vegas charm.

Our server, Karen, was perfect- funny, efficient and totally grabbed our names from our IDs, and then used them for the evening. When she first called us "Robert and Misti," we flipped out in a "is she stalking us?" kind of way, but she reminded us she had checked our IDs. Phew.

She recommended the Cajun wings and the pizza, so we did just that. We started off with the $2.50 side salad, which was okay, but with a couple of browning leafs. The pizza was delicious. The crust could have used a bit more crisp, but overall, the flavor and freshness made the pie worth a repeat eat (especially if they are indeed half-priced on the weekends as other reviews indicate!).

The wings were my favorite! They are dry and coated with Cajun spices, and I found myself sucking down every last morsel, which is a rare occurrence when I am eating wings. Usually, after about 4 wings, I start to lose interest, but I plowed through all 5 of my half and could have eaten a few more. 

This should definitely be on your short list of classic bars to visit.

We go to Tap House about once a week for a good, quick and inexpensive meal.  I like the atmosphere of the restaurant and it still kind of represents the old Las Vegas.  The staff is always pleasant enough.  Even when they are understaffed they handle it well.  There is a wrap around bar with plenty of slot machines and enough booths and tables so there is never a wait to be seated.  The only issue we have ever had was with one waitress "Ozlem" who seemed very cranky and not happy to be there.  She was so unfriendly and had no personality and even laid our check on the table while walking by without saying a word.  Everyone has a bad day so we will chalk it up to that since it was our very first bad experience there.   We will keep going though unless that waitress becomes a trend in the restaurant then we will move on.

I am a huge fan of the tap house. This is your "get off of work have a beer" spot-type of place. Equipped with a jukebox, shuffle board, darts, booths, tables, full range bar with low priced drinks and full variety menu. Open 24/7. Service is great. NOT SMOKEY. 

I absolutely love their jamaician spicy flavored hot wings/fingers! This is bar food so don't expect top of the line but I was surprised at how good the wings were. Overall the atmosphere is chill, I love meeting up w friends here and I always have a good time :)

Rude and unprofessional!!! Well, I was going to try this establishment.  I changed my mind, however! 

I walked in, and there was no "wait to be serrated" or "seat yourself" sign,.  When I looked around unsure of rather to sit or wait, I was passed by a waitress that thought so highly of herself that she didn't give eye contact, or acknowledge my presence in the slightest.  

Way to seem inviting to a new customer.  I'll take my business elsewhere, and I suggest you do to!

After visiting some GREAT dive bars on this Las Vegas trip . . . this one left us wanting so much more . . . the bar was packed with regulars . . . and the drinks came quickly and were reasonably priced.

We were ther at shift change . . . and when the change was complete . . . 3/4 of the bar left . . . not quite sure why . . . becasue the service seemed to stay the same . . . it just left us wanting more.

One last thing . . . if you are going to make a shrine to you favorite football team . . . you might want to move it away from the front door . . . unless you only want to attract those fans.

On the fence as to whether or not a return trip will occur.
pretty good food and atmosphere. browns fans unite every Sunday easily the best Browns bar in Vegas!
Good locals place to catch a game on tv.great wings and cold beer.home for all the cleveland teams,browns, cavs and of course ohio state.

Great food at fair prices.  Try the Cajun baked chicken wings or stromboli.

The downside (and reason I didn't give it 5 stars) is that this bar continues to insult all intelligent people and allow smoking in the dining area.  Too bad, but maybe seedy is the crowd they want.

They have the BEST Cajun Wings( or any wings) in Vegas!  The service is hit and miss, but the food is the star of the show.  I would have given it 5 stars if the waitress had paid attention to her job instead of talking to other employees.  Hopefully there will be a different waitress when I return.  The food is excellent so The Tap House deserves another chance.

This place is like going back to the 50's bar or early 60's scene in NY, but in Vegas. It's a Monday night and it's packed with very few of the Millennial crowd. The music was a mixture of everything. Since  Monday is an off day for many of singers and other musical acts, it's not unusual  for them to sing a song or two. We had a Frank Sinatra and a Neil Diamond. Also, this other lady you would of thought was Aretha Franklin's younger sister....killer voice! The food is Italian, very good calzones, pizza and chicken wings. Very eclectic and fun

Not a fan.  Service is horrible usually on Saturday nights, which is when I'm usually dragged in there.  I've ordered food every time, and I'm not a picky eater by any means, but the only thing I can say I've not been disappointed in is the fries?  I am not a smoker, so this place automatically assaults me as soon as I walk it, but hey, it's a bar so it's expected I guess!!  The only reason I ever go back is because there are others in my group of friends who think the fried fish is good but I've not been impressed.  I even ordered a grilled cheese once, and it was COLD in the middle and the cheese wasn't melted....who screws up GRILLED CHEESE?  At least the fries where hot this time!  A friend had a French Dip sandwich recently that looked fairly decent, but she said the meat was "dry" and she really needed the au jus to make it palatable.  If you're looking for a smoky dive bar to drink and oggle others, this place is fairly well lit so you'd probably enjoy it.  Just don't expect great service if you're ordering food, and don't expect the food to be good either!  I'm going back again I'm sure, and will be trying the pizza since that's what other Yelpers seem to recommend.

THAT was a fantastic pizza!!! $12 for a large "Fellini" topped with sausage, mushrooms, salami, peppers and olives definitely hit the spot.  All the pizzas are done in a pan which made the Fellini taste like a homemade Pizza Hut supreme.  I haven't been to another spot in LV that does it quite like this and it'll be the best reason to come back.

There were definitely some minuses like the smokiness and I felt like the whole area was lacking sufficient lighting.  So if you're trying to lay low and avoid people that may be looking for you (manhunts, warrants, ex-spouses, Rent A Center)) this place will do the trick....unless they happen to be a Cleveland Browns fan.  I think this is one of two Browns bars in Vegas.  So when are they erecting the Brian Hoyer statue upfront? (Edit: Hoyer tore his ACL a week after this review ending his season) 

Speaking of football, we were there catching the second half of the Monday night game (Broncos vs Raiders) when music started kicking in from the other room.  Their "Monday Nites Jamming" was rocking.  The whole room on the other side was packed with people by 8pm partying like it was 1979.  I was impressed.  

They also offer daily specials like burger and a beer Mondays but it's got to be all about their pizza!!  Half price pizzas all day Saturdays/Sundays and after midnight!
Stopped in here with some friends has a Great Steak Sandwich! Local atmosphere nice people mostly regulars it seemed like bartenders and waitresses knew everyones name Friendly staff will be back!

This is good divey kinda bar if you are in the area or a Cleveland Browns fan.  The bartenders are friendly and some regular named Jimmy was highly entertaining for at least a couple of hours.  On the other hand the video poker tapped me out.  I would come back to try wings or try to make my money back...lol.

Love this place.

Vegan now, so we don't go there to eat that much anymore, but the thin crust veggie pizza with no cheese is vegan.

The chicken wings here, are amazing.  One of the things I truly miss now that I am veg.  If an order of cajin wings comes out.. I seriously consider cheating some times.  Servers are always attentive, and nice.  If your not a regular it can be hard to get noticed, but just speak up and they will help you out.

Mondays are kind of nutty here.  The mix of people the come in for the band makes for entertainment in and of it's self.  No were else can you see Phyllis and Bob from the nursing home sipping on their vodka tonics,  sitting next to the Pawn Stars guy, who has a long haired burn out sitting behind him.  And just than Oscar Goodman walks in...  It truly is magical how it all plays together under this roof.

Décor is vintage, and should never ever change.  Smokey, and loud most of the night, but bright and super quiet during the day when one of the owners is there.  It's eerie.  Only gripe is they get on me for vaping, even if I blow it right into the exhaust vent, but you can smoke your dam brains out.  Cigars, pipes, hell probably even a hookah BUT NO VAPING!!!

Great spot for good pizza and beer. EXCEPT for the local "drunk" passed out, snoring in the booth next to us in the middle of the afternoon. People who worked there knew the guy, but they didn't do anything or seem to care til we said something to our waitress.

Wow, second time I've been to this place in Vegas, both times friends of a friend brought us to this cool, unassuming little place.  Nice surroundings and ambiance, no hype or fancy BS, just comfortable surroundings and a nice old school feel with classic rock and country playing in the background.  Great, friendly, attentive staff.

The food is pretty much off the charts for the money.  Spaghetti and meatballs a solid choice, can't go wrong.  Tried the cheese ravioli, perfectly cooked with a good tasting filling in a rich, delicious pink sauce. 

The Cajun wings were outstanding, perfectly cooked and tender, not chewy like a lot of places, with a spicy, flavorful crust on them, seriously the best wings I've ever had any flavor, any style.  They have other wing flavorings as well, but I don't know how the Cajun wings can be topped.

I guess they have a lot of other good stuff too, especially pizza based on the rave reviews.   I love pizza so rest assured next time I'm in Vegas I'll definitely come back to give it a try.

i go here all the time i work across the street until today ... ordered chicken strips after i got throuh the first strip and thinking it tasted different i cut into the other 3 and noticed they were all raw inside ... sent back strips and girl didnt even act like it was a big deal, ordered a sandwich and couldnt eat it. i got charged full price no compensation no appology needless to say ill never return and niether will my employess
Best wings in the WORLD! Twice baked Cajun wings. Cold beer and friendly people. The Italian food is good also.

Get the chicken wings!! They are made dry (not saucy wet).  The cajun is the best.  the rest of the food we hav e tasted is mediocre at best--but the wings blow them all away! Two friendly waitresses.  We have only been there about 5 times since we started going about 10 weeks ago and they know what we drink!  Yes, how they allow smoking and food, I don't know.

Stopped here on my lunch break today for chicken wings and fries. The wings were fabulous. The right amount of crispy and flavor. The server Rachel was great. Definitely recommend this for lunch or dinner.

*Smoker friendly, as advertised on the sign outside. 

I guess "smoker friendly" means non-smoker hostile. They brazenly ignore the non-smoking law enacted by voters. 

I was invited to join a gathering here. I came away with my clothes reeking of cigarette smoke.  My sinuses were clogged with smoke stench. This is one reason I stay away from crappy bars like this.

Meanwhile reports from fellow attendees were that the food and drinks are good.  I had a martini for $5.50.  Is that a good price?  I seldom frequent these places so I wouldn't know if $5.50 is a good price.

The waitress was a sweet old gal.  She was so friendly she was kind of cute.

Meanwhile, a very young waitress informed me that standing in the bar area is not allowed.  I would have to find a seat, even if it meant sitting with strangers at a table.  What?  I've been in numerous bars where at least half the crowd stands.

"Is it a fire regulation?"
"Sort of," she said.

So how do you like this?  The Tap House openly defies state law enacted by voters but insists on an inexplicable restriction on standing at the bar.  They're a neighborhood institution, so I'm sure they'll do fine without me.

If you enjoy the typical smoke-filled dive, this is the place for you.

I come here all the time. I usually order the cajun wings. But today, recommended by the waitress, I ordered the the Philly cheese steak. In it, it had peppers, cheese and bits of bacon.  What?  Yea...bacon. From the first bit melted in my mouth and with in a few minutes the sandwich was gone. Wow!  Delicious. I added extra peppers to it, also recommended by the waitress. It added a nice kick to the sandwich. I've had cheese steaks before and sometimes they are hit and misses. This one was a home run.

I have lived in this town for 16 years. Came of age here and have tried to experience the great food that all of the diversity in this town brings. I have to say that this place takes my trophy for pizza. It's delicious! I would know because I owned a pizza place. One can taste how authentic and fresh everything on that pizza is. The crust is perfect and so is the price. Plus... Can't beat the $2.50 domestic draught!! I highly recommend this hidden west side gem!

This by far is the best place to go for wings! They're just amazing! Other than the service being extremely slow and inattentive  (depending on who you get) Donna is ALWAYS on top of everything, and there's another girl that's really good, but I've waited for 15 minutes without even being addressed. Then going to the bar myself to order. But well worth it for the wings. If you're not in a hurry definitely go here! Their clams and pizzas are phenomenal as well. One of my all time favorite places to go. Give them a chance, their food is well worth it! You won't be disappointed.
